not from friendship at all; I simply feel that the army is my vocation." 
He glanced at his cousin and the young lady visitor; and they were both regarding him with a smile of approbation. 
"Schubert, the colonel of the Pdvlograd Hus- sars, is dining with us today. He has been here on leave and is taking Nicholas back with him. It can't be helped!" said the count, shrugging his shoulders and speaking playfully of a mat- ter that evidently distressed him.
